summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackAchieve healthy, ultra-clean skin with a double cleansing regimen that begins with Dermalogica Precleanse Cleansing Oil. Crafted with vitamin E and vitamin C, this cleansing oil helps to gently remove make-up, sunscreen and impurities from skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsMelt away makeup, sunscreen and daily pollution build-up, with the Double Cleanse regimen that begins with this Dermalogica Best SellerThis plant-based cleansing oil is lightweightGreat for all skin types and can be used around the eye area to wash away even the toughest waterproof mascara without leaving a residueComplete your Double Cleanse regimen with Dermalogica's Special Cleansing Gel (sold separately) to help you achieve ultra-squeaky-clean skinKey IngredientsVitamin E: nourishes and protects skin from damageRice Bran: rich in oryzanol which is high in antioxidants and packed with B vitamins to soften skinKukui Nut: abundant source of vitamin A, vitamin C, vitamin E, and omega 3 fatty acids that reinforce the protective skin barrierItem 2249581How To UseDispense into dry hands and massage over dry face and eyes to dissolve surface oil and dirt. Concentrate on areas of congestion or stubborn debris. Wet hands and continue massaging to create a light, milky emulsion. Rinse with lukewarm water and follow with Special Cleansing Gel (sold separately).IngredientsCaprylic/Capric Triglyceride, PEG-40 Sorbitan Peroleate, Prunus Armeniaca (Apricot) Kernel Oil, Tocopherol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Borago Officinalis Seed Oil, Citrus Paradisi ( Grapefruit) Peel Oil, Citrus Nobilis (Mandarin Orange) Peel Oil, Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Extract, Aleurites Moluccanus Seed Oil, Cymbopogon Citratus Leaf Oil, Lavandula Hybrida Oil, Oryza Sativa (Rice) Bran Oil, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Citral, Limonene, Linalool.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Dispense into dry hands and massage over dry face and eyes to dissolve surface oil and dirt. Concentrate on areas of congestion or stubborn debris. Wet hands and continue massaging to create a light, milky emulsion. Rinse with lukewarm water and follow with Special Cleansing Gel (sold separately).

reviews.headline: This product performs!
reviews.comments: I needed a product that would help breakdown and get rid of my sunscreen and makeup on the first try because I was having to rewash my face to actually feel clean and clear of the sunscreen and makeup from other face washes that weren't performing like the product said it would. I'm in LOVE with this product because it  performs! I'm a BiG fan of Dermalogica and this product just won me over again!

reviews.headline: Not good
reviews.comments: Broke me out

reviews.headline: I like it
reviews.comments: It gets most of my tubing mascara off. I do use cere ve soap as my 2nd wash, and a also a toner, which takes the rest off. The only down is that it squirts out more than you need. I would buy again. It does not burn, nor leave a blurry film over m6 eyes, which many other brands of oils have.

reviews.headline: Favorite 1st step in two part cleansing
reviews.comments: My esthetician recommends washing one's face twice and  she said this is a great first wash to get the makeup and surface level impurities. She said the second clease with a cleaser will then be able to clean deep in pores. Don't ever want to be without this silky feeling preclease. It's one of my favorite products in my skincare routine. Love it and all Dermalogica products I've tried!

reviews.headline: Broken pump lead to breakouts
reviews.comments: My bottle had the defect where the pump was super sensitive, causing it to spray oil everywhere when applied pressure. After using the product fully, I unscrewed the top for the first time to use up the last little bit and I noticed there was mold and bacteria at the bottom. I was unaware of this while using the product for months and had developed REALLY bad acne. Puberty level acne. I've been in contact with Dermalogica directly informing them. One month later (after mold dicsovery) my skin has completely cleared up. I switched to Kiehls Midnight Recovery Cleansing oil and it's thriving!

reviews.headline: Worth the Price for Clean, Hydrated Skin
reviews.comments: Not only is this my go-to face cleanser each morning and evening, it also does an excellent job of removing my makeup after a dance show. Despite its strength, it leaves my combination skin feeling clean yet still hydrated. It's a bit pricey, but I find it worth every pennyâ€”plus, buying the larger size offers the best value. Recommended by my dermatologist, it's been a reliable staple in my routine for years. Though, keep it out of your eyes as I've had some minor irritation!

reviews.headline: Good cleansing oil
reviews.comments: This cleansing oil is powerfull it takes off my mascara and make up no issue. My skin is super happy when i use it. The is a strong aroma thearapy smell I associate with the cleansing oil so if you dont want to smell the product this wouldnr be for you. Since it is a more organic scent it doesnt bother me. Very nice cleansing oil, I would buy again but only on sale. Very pricy.

reviews.headline: The Best!
reviews.comments: This product is incredible! It removes every trace of mascara. I have sensitive, reactive skin, and have no problems using it. Also, doesn't sting, or smell of industrial cleaner! I've been using it, for years!

reviews.headline: switch off between this and elemis cleansing balm!
reviews.comments: i usually have been using the DHC oil makeup remover but this one is SO MUCH BETTER! i use less, its more effective, can use it on my sensistive eyes and leaves my skin so hydrated and glowy! the one "turn off" to the product would be its highly scented, doesnt bother me but fyi for others!

reviews.headline: scented
reviews.comments: it wasnt that great especially for the price. it is scented and for me when something is scented so heavily it seems cheap also it burned my eyes and made them watery also when you push the pump down it come out SO FAST and goes put the hand

reviews.headline: ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ
reviews.comments: I love this product! It doesn't leave a greasy feeling and its gets everything off. I don't use waterproof mascara but non-waterproof mascara doesn't stand a chance against this.

reviews.headline: Holy Grail
reviews.comments: bought this on a 21 day beauty sale and will continue to purchase for its amazing smell and how easy it makes it to remove stubborn makeup.  I find using this first to help lift off any mascara, lip stain, or oil based product and then I use my face wash to rinse off.  it's amazing how easy this takes off makeup without having to scrub or go over multiple times.  it saves on using less of my normal face wash and I just tried it as a first step in cleaning my makeup brushes and especially with my foundation brushes I was shocked at how it removed the product.  this product does everything it claims and is worth spending extra on.  don't pass up if on sale

reviews.headline: Does NOT remove makeup
reviews.comments: This is a wasted step and money.  This doesn't remove eye makeup or foundation.  I don't wear a lot of foundation, being over 45, settles into lines and it still doesn't remove all of it. I always have racoon eyes too and and must use eye makeup remover.

reviews.headline: Double cleanse
reviews.comments: This is a classic for a reason. My skin is glowing now that I'm using this again as step 1 in my nightly double cleanse routine!

reviews.headline: Doesn't remove all mascara
reviews.comments: Was SO excited to try this but was disappointed. I wear several coats of mascara daily and this does not take all of it off. Also leaves your eyes blurry. Took all other face make up off but the mascara

reviews.headline: Doesn't remove all mascara
reviews.comments: Was SO excited to try this but was disappointed. I wear several coats of mascara daily and this does not take all of it off. Also leaves your eyes blurry. Took all other face make up off but the mascara

reviews.headline: Caused Contact Dermatitis
reviews.comments: Been using it for couple of months and started causing a red rash under my eyes. Couldnt figure it out until i stopped using this.

reviews.headline: Favorite cleansing oil
reviews.comments: She's pricey, but worth every penny!  This oil takes off all my makeup, doesn't dry out my skin, doesn't sting my eyes and doesn't leave a film over my eyes.  10/10 recommend.

reviews.headline: I am obsessed !!!
reviews.comments: I had been never a oil-based cleanser fan before. Just tried this product because it was on-sales, but never thought it is that good. The smell, the texture, everything. It gives the clean feeling but still very hydrate and gentle to my skin. This is a game changer. Love it !!!

reviews.headline: Smells so good and cleanses gently
reviews.comments: I would get facials and they would use this precleanser. I loved the smell so much I bought some of my own and it's been one of my favorite cleansers to both remove light makeup and pamper myself. I have combination and sensitive skin and its kept it calm and balanced (especially living in such a dry climate).

media.headline: How did I go without this for so long?
I will only get wen they don't sell coconut oil

faceoff_positive.comments:
I typically wouldn't buy an "oil based cleanser"... but a kind lady at Ulta recommended I use this before using the ultra calming cleanser (that will be another review- 5!)
I have combo skin- sometimes dry patches, shiny nose, acne scars, and hormonal acne along the jawline. These reasons alone make me cringe at the thought of oil cleanser.
I honestly bought this knowing that I could (and probably would) return it. The "thought" made me think it wouldn't work out for my skin. BOY WAS I WRONG!
The first time I used it, it was a little odd to rub oil into your skin (dry hands and dry skin)... but the massage felt great, and the scent is pleasant. I rubbed it all over my eyes, and it never stung. When I added water it became milky and I could literally see makeup dripping off my face (I made a huge mess of my bathroom counter!). I rinsed it off with warm water. My face immediately felt soft, and SO clean! I know that it cleaned my makeup off amazingly, because after using this, I used the ultra calming cleanser with my clarisonic and my bristles of the clarisonic were CLEAN without a trace of makeup on them)
I have not had any reactions to this, and I truly feel that my face is cleaner after using my face wash.
The bottle is pretty large, and will last a LONG time. I only use about a dime to penny size of product in my palm and it takes off: primer, foundation, powder, blush, mascara, eye liner, and eyeshadows.
Give it a try!
faceoff_positive.headline: never thought i'd like "oil based"

faceoff_negative.comments:
I love this product 
But for the Price is not worth it ,is To Small and wen you finish pumping it on the palm of your hand a lot go to waste , all I have to say is for the price is not worth it , I will continue to use my coconut out to take my makeup off
